00011 //============================================================================
00012 Point3D Projection(Point3D &p,Point3D &p0,Point3D &p1){
00013 //============================================================================
00014   Vector3D v(p0,p1);
00015   Vector3D w(p0,p);
00016   Point3D pr=v.linear(w.dot(v)/v.dot(v),p0);
00017   return pr;
00018 }
00019 //============================================================================
00020 bool Point3D::IsBetween(Point3D &p0,Point3D &p1){
00021 //============================================================================
00022   if((x>max(p0.x,p1.x)) || (x<min(p0.x,p1.x))||
00023      (y>max(p0.y,p1.y)) || (y<min(p0.y,p1.y))||
00024      (z>max(p0.z,p1.z)) || (z<min(p0.z,p1.z)))
00025     return false;
00026   return true;
00027 }
00028 //============================================================================
00029 double angle_dist(double t1,double p1,double t2,double p2){
00030 //============================================================================
00031   double angle=sin(t1)*cos(p1)*sin(t2)*cos(p2)+
00032                sin(t1)*sin(p1)*sin(t2)*sin(p2)+
00033                cos(t1)*cos(t2);
00034   if(angle>1.0)
00035     return 0.0;
00036   return fabs(acos(angle));
00037 }
00038 //============================================================================
00039 void Order_Max(int n,double *a,int m, double *b, int *ia){
00040 //============================================================================
00041 /*      Utility routine to find M smallest values                    
00042  from N values and thier addresses in the initial array
00043  Can be used if M << N in opposite case better use SORTZV (CERN-lib)                
00044     Author    V.L. Morgunov, V.A. Ivanova  created   04-Sep-2001
00045     rewitten to C++ at 30-Nov-2006
00046  INPUT  n -- initial array size                               
00047         a -- Array with tested numbers                        
00048         m -- Number of needed min numbers                     
00049  OUTPUT
00050         b -- Sorted array                                     
00051         ia -- addresses of sorted numbers in initial array    
00052 */
00053   for(int l = 0; l < m; l++)
00054     b[l] = 1.e10;
00055 
00056   int key = 0;
00057   int i,j,k;
00058   double aa;
00059   for(i = 0; i < n; i++){
00060     aa = a[i];
00061     for(j = 0; j < m; j++){
00062       if(aa > b[j]){
00063         for(k=key; k > j; k--){
00064            b[k] =  b[k-1];
00065           ia[k] = ia[k-1];
00066         }
00067         key = key + 1;
00068         if(key >= m-1) 
00069           key = m-1;
00070         b[j] = aa;
00071         ia[j] = i;
00072         break;
00073       }
00074     }
00075   }
00076 } 
00077   /*
00078 //============================================================================
00079 void FastOrder_Min(int n,double *a,int m, double *b, int *ia){
00080 //============================================================================
00081       Utility routine to find M smallest values                    
00082  from N values and thier addresses in the initial array
00083  Can be used if M << N in opposite case better use SORTZV (CERN-lib)                
00084     Author    V.L. Morgunov, V.A. Ivanova  created   04-Sep-2001
00085     Modified A.V. Zhelezov, 30-Nov-2006
00086  INPUT  n -- initial array size                               
00087         a -- Array with tested numbers                        
00088         m -- Number of needed min numbers                     
00089  OUTPUT
00090         b -- Sorted array                                     
00091         ia -- addresses of sorted numbers in initial array    
00092 
00093   if(m>n)
00094     m=n;
00095 
00096   struct _fom {
00097     struct _fom *nxt;
00098     struct _fom *prv;
00099     int idx;
00100   } fom[m];
00101   struct _fom *head=0;
00102   int key_count=0;
00103 
00104   for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
00105     double aa=a[i];
00106     struct _fom *p;
00107     for(p=head;p;p=p->nxt)
00108       if(aa<a[p->idx])
00109         break;
00110     if(!p){
00111       if(key_count==m)
00112         continue;
00113       struct _fom *tail=fom+key_count;
00114       key_count++;
00115       tail->idx=i;
00116       tail->nxt=0;
00117       if(head){
00118         tail->prv=head->prv;
00119         head->prv->nxt=tail;
00120         head->prv=tail;
00121       } else
00122         tail->prv=head=tail;
00123     } else {
00124       if(key_count==m){
00125         struct _fom *crt=head->prv;
00126         if(crt!=p){
00127           crt->prv->next=0;
00128           head->prv=ctr->prv;
00129           crt->nxt=p;
00130           if(p==head){
00131             crt->prv=head->prv;
00132             head->prv=crt;
00133             head=crt;
00134           } else {
00135             p->prv->nxt=crt;
00136             crt->prv=p->prv;
00137             p->prv=crt;
00138           }
00139         }
00140         crt->idx=i;
00141       } else {
00142         ...
00143       }
00144     }
00145   }
00146  }
00147 */

00149 //====================================================
00150 void accumulate(Vector3D &centerOfGravity, Point3D &point3d, double ampl)
00151 {
00152   centerOfGravity.x += ampl * point3d.x;
00153   centerOfGravity.y += ampl * point3d.y;
00154   centerOfGravity.z += ampl * point3d.z;
00155 }
00156 double dist2line(Point3D &point1, Point3D &point2, Vector3D &vec)
00157 {
00158   Vector3D vecFromPoints(point1, point2);
00159   Vector3D vecDiff(vec.y * vecFromPoints.z - vec.z * vecFromPoints.y,
00160                    vec.z * vecFromPoints.x - vec.x * vecFromPoints.z,
00161                    vec.x * vecFromPoints.y - vec.y * vecFromPoints.x);
00162   double output = vecDiff.module()/vec.module();
00163   return output;
00164 }
00165 Vector3D directionCos(Vector3D &vec)
00166 {
00167   double tmp = 1./vec.module();
00168   Vector3D vecOut(vec.x * tmp, vec.y * tmp, vec.z * tmp);
00169   return vecOut;
00170 }
00171 void initializeSphere(Sphere3D &sphere, double radius, double theta, double phi)
00172 {
00173   sphere.r = radius;
00174   sphere.t = theta;
00175   sphere.p = phi;
00176 }
